name: Trees in Hiding Online Trivia | Word Play | 10 Questions

questions.text: Pay me a nickel and you will own it.
questions.explanation:
Willow.

	Pay me a nickel and you WILL OWn it.  Usually found growing near water, the willow tree is known for its pliable branches and narrow leaves, as well as for the catkins it produces. The willow has been used for centuries to make baskets and other woven objects. In some cultures the willow tree is a symbol of mourning.

questions.text: Doing the laundry sometimes makes me feel indentured.
questions.explanation:
Linden.

	Doing the laundry sometimes makes me feeL INDENtured. The linden tree is often used for landscaping due to its fast growth and stately appearance. In the spring, the linden tree has fragrant yellow flowers and lovely green leaves. In places other than the U.S., this tree is sometimes called a lime tree or basswood tree.

questions.text: Mama, please make your special meatloaf.
questions.explanation:
Maple.

	MaMA, PLEase make your special meatloaf. The lovely maple tree is usually found growing in cooler climates and is known for the vibrant colors produced by the leaves in the fall. The maple produces a beautiful hardwood that is favored by furniture makers. The sap of the maple evaporates down into the delectable breakfast favorite known as maple syrup.

questions.text: When will architecture be offered in high school?
questions.explanation:
Larch.

	When wilL ARCHitecture be offered in high school? The coniferous larch tree is found in the cooler regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The larch is used in the production of turpentine and it yields a strong, very durable wood.

questions.text: The actress left her feathered boa behind.
questions.explanation:
Boab.

	The actress left her feathered BOA Behind. The boab tree is an unusual tree that is found only in Australia. The boab (part of the larger baobab family found in Africa), has a huge trunk which is used to store water. It often appears to have no, or very few, leaves. The bark of the boab can be used to make cloth, the leaves are used as medicines, and its fruit is very tasty and nutritious.

questions.text: The man groveled in an attempt to get a massage.
questions.explanation:
Mangrove.

	The MAN GROVEled in an attempt to get a massage. The mangrove tree is usually found growing tropical, coastal swamplands. The root system of the mangrove is partially above ground/water and helps to form a foundation for the unique ecosystems found in mangrove swamps. Many animals make their homes in the intricate root system of the mangrove including shrimp, oysters, barnacles and sponges.

questions.text: The bumblebee chewed on the flower's stamen.
questions.explanation:
Beech.

	The bumbleBEE CHewed on the flower's stamen.  The beech tree is a large deciduous tree with glossy leaves and smooth grayish bark. This majestic tree is found in North America, Europe and Asia, and is known for the hard, lightly-hued lumber it produces. The fruit of the beech tree is an important food source for many wild birds and mammals that share the same ecosystem.

questions.text: Nancy pressed for more information for her news report.
questions.explanation:
Cypress.

	NanCY PRESSed for more information for her news report. The cypress tree is an evergreen coniferous tree that has overlapping, somewhat scaly leaves. The cypress tree has fragrant wood and has been used in the art of distilling for thousands of years. The cypress has a long life span, with some species known to be healthy after 1,000 years.

questions.text: The osteopath has pens made from fossilized shark bone.
questions.explanation:
Aspen.

	The osteopath hAS PENS made from fossilized shark bone. The aspen tree is well known for its lovely hardwood as well as the sound made by its leaves when the wind blows. There are many species, but most have leaves which turn yellow in the fall, and the trees have greenish-gray bark. The aspen has a very large root system and has been known to infiltrate man-made water systems such as sewers and septic tanks.

questions.text: I want some soda pop, large glasses and ice cubes.
questions.explanation:
Poplar.

	I want some soda POP, LARge glasses and ice cubes. The slender poplar tree has soft wood, rough bark, and small flowers. This adaptable tree can be found in many ecosystems and has a variety of sub-species. The poplar is a fast-growing tree and is often used in landscaping because of that fact.
